meanings.definition: The Islamic declaration of faith, affirming that there is no god but Allah and Muhammad is his prophet.
meanings.sent1: During the ceremony, the new Muslim recited the shahada with great reverence.
meanings.sent2: Every practicing Muslim holds the shahada as a fundamental belief.
meanings.sent3: The parrot surprised everyone by squawking the shahada in perfect Arabic!
meanings.sent4: Her commitment to the shahada was as unwavering as a mountain.
meanings.sent5: The shahada echoed through the mosque, filling the hearts of the faithful with peace.

meanings.definition: A statement of belief in the oneness of God in Islam.
meanings.sent1: The shahada emphasizes the unity of Allah in Islamic teachings.
meanings.sent2: Muslims often recite the shahada as a reminder of their faith.
meanings.sent3: The children giggled as they made a game out of reciting the shahada together.
meanings.sent4: The beauty of the sunset reflected the simplicity of the shahada.
meanings.sent5: In times of doubt, the shahada serves as a beacon of clarity for believers.
